author: FTSE

resources.description: HTML page with table of most recent weekly FTSE UK Index Series Values (links to CSV but CSV is very poorly formatted)
resources.name: ftse-uk-series-values-weekly-most-recent

organization.description: Group for Economics data especially that which is [open data](http://opendefinition.org/). This can be any kind of data related to economics from development to finance, and micro to macro. We run an open group policy so anyone can add datasets to this group but we will review datasets added to the group for quality.
organization.title: Economics Datasets
organization.name: economics

name: ftse-uk-index-series
notes:
Data on the FTSE UK Index Series including value, P/E ratio. The UK Index Series is designed to represent the performance of UK companies, providing investors with a comprehensive and complementary set of indices that measure the performance of all capital and industry segments of the UK equity market.

### Data

Series covered:

* FTSE 100 Index
* FTSE 250 Index
* FTSE All-Share Index
* FTSE 100 Declared Dividend Index
* FTSE 100 Dividend Index - RDSA Withholding
* FTSE UK Capped Index Series
* FTSE UK Dividend+ Index
* FTSE 350 Supersectors Index
* FTSE UK Style Index
* FTSE Expiry Index
* FTSE SmallCap Index
* FTSE Fledgling Index
* FTSE All-Small Index

Some digging around yields a link to most recent weekly data in HTML table form (see resources). There is also a CSV version linked from that HTML page but so imperfectly formatted -- lots of blanks lines, includes table heading -- that it was worth linking directly to that.


### Openness: NOT OPEN

See [Terms of Use](http://www.ftse.com/Terms.jsp) which states:

> You may only use the FTSE Media for your own non-commercial personal use and only in accordance with these terms.

Not entirely clear whether this covers data (but would assume so) and in addition there is a detailed [Data Licenses](http://www.ftse.com/Indices/Data_Licenses/index.jsp) which indicates a license is  required for data use (at least in quantity).
title: FTSE UK Index Series
